title: pvp.net kernel crashing
body:
i just installed lol today to plan  to play with friends. however this thing is haunting me to no end.

im on windows 10 and done most of the troubleshooting thats everywhere on google and the forums.

i start it, the logo comes up and in a second, the error pops up saying pvp.net kernel has an error and must close.

replies.body:
I got this problem (PVP.net patcher kernel has stopped working) after each patch... 

I tried to fix it (run as admin, delete files, check for updates... nothing works)

And magically a couple of days later everything is just fine -_-
After each patch i gotta wait like 3 days before being able to launch and dl the new patch  :/

Assuming you've already tried [reinstalling league](http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234176-reinstalling-league-of-legends), have a go with the following.

> 1: Sometimes, simply shutting down your computer, walking away, doing something for 30 minutes, and then coming back to try again makes the program load. It will start, run a patch, then work. I am not so sure why this is.

>2: Restart the router. Power cycle it by unplugging for 15 seconds, then plugging power back in. 

>3: Replace <install directory>/RADS/system/rads_user_kernel.exe with this file, http://l3cdn.riotgames.com/releases/live/system/rads_user_kernel.exe

>4: Delete the folder: C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_launcher
Re-open LoL. 

>5: Delete:
- everything inside C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\downloads
- lol_air_client and lol_air_client_config_na inside C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects
- everything inside C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\solutions

>After deleting ,restart your computer. When restarted, run League of Legends in Administrator Mode.

>Download and install Adobe AIR.
Download and install Adobe Flash.
Download and install C++ Redistributable (32-bit) (64-bit).
Download and install DirectX 9.0c.
Download and install .NET 3.5.
Download and install .NET 4.0.
Restart the PC.
Run Windows Update and do all important and optional updates.

thanks for the reply.

few things, i did reinstall rads user kernel

there is no downloads folder, lol_air_client nor config in the projects (only the lol_launcher)

solutions is a blank folder.

EDIT: done everyhing as well like downloading air & flash.

correct me if im wrong, but when i first ran the installer, i think c++ and directX installed via the installer.

.NET both are intalled as well as windows updates are uptodate

Have you tried running the launcher in compatibility mode?

This can be accomplished by right clicking the league of legends launcher executable, going to the compatibility tab and enabling  "run this program in compatibility mode", select Windows Vista for the OS. Don't forget to run as Administrator :)

yup. tried all modes of compatbility mode. from windows 8 k to XP. still no fix =/

would running my pc on a korean version of windows 10 be an issue? (using OCE client)

Doubtful, i've not heard of system language being an issue however it might be possible.
Do you have the correct language packs installed? Try changing your system language to english and see if that resolves the issue.

Apologies, I had to leave for work suddenly last night and didnt get a chance to reply, however it seems Wuks has said what i was going to suggest, I'd also recommend switching to google's public DNS server, a guide for which can be found [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
Try temporarily disabling any firewalls and antivirus applications that you may have running, and see if one of those are interfering with the client's ability to run.
